• SyncEvent

SyncEvent¶

The sync protocol is used to syncronize different review tools to each other. It can also be used to record the activities of a review tool, either for later playback or for parts of the playback (e.g. just for annotations)>

See:

  • https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dmo5Le5elqNNl9p4GpcRPT76BV7r6KYtrapHITD25uA/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.3jckyebptegj

  • https://lf-aswf.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PRWG/pages/11274625/OTIO-Based+Synchronized+Review+Messaging#Annotation-Schemas

SyncEvents¶

class schemadefs.SyncEvent.MediaChange(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: SyncEvent

A schema for the event system to denote when media changes. mediaReference is an otio.core.MediaReference timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string representing the time of the change. This is used to track when media changes occur in the timeline.

property mediaReference

The reference to the media

class schemadefs.SyncEvent.PaintStart(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: SyncEvent

A schema for the event system to denote when painting starts. timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string representing the time of the change. This is used to track when media changes occur in the timeline.

property brush

The brush type of the paint event

property friendly_name

The friendly artist name for the paint event creator

property ghost

Is ghosting of the paint strokes enabled

property ghost_after

Number of frames to ghost after the current frame

property ghost_before

Number of frames to ghost before the current frame

property hold

The hold of the paint event

The range of the layer for the paint event

The unique identifier for the participant

The index of the source media for the paint.

property type

The type of the paint event

The unique identifier for the paint event

The visible type of the paint event

class schemadefs.SyncEvent.Play(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: SyncEvent

A schema for the event system to define when play is enabled.

timestamp

timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string representing the time of the change. This is used to track when media changes occur in the timeline.

Type:

str

value

value is a boolean indicating whether play is enabled or not.

Type:

bool

property value

The value of the play event

class schemadefs.SyncEvent.SyncEvent(timestamp=None)[source]

Bases: SerializableObject

This is the base-class of all schema events.

timestamp

timestamp is an ISO 8601 formatted string representing the time of the change. This is used to track when media changes occur in the timeline.

Type:

str

property timestamp

The timestamp of the media change, in ISO 8601 format
